Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery handless miniature chalice or kantharos; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish in places); palmette with added red and added white petals, red centre with white outline above white and red bands; at bottom, further white and red bands; exterior: unslipped; splash of black on edge of rim; on left, two vertical dilute lines with parts of dots or bars to their left; below, two brown, near horizontal strokes with possible faded white between.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.1269
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1515) (phase 2)
